channel.title: Does Any1 Know How
channel.description: Hello again i am making a 317 client and i was wondering how can i make my server a spawning one plze reply i would like 2 no thanks :confused: :D

item.title: Does Any1 Know How
item.dc:creator: @whattehp406 whattehp406
item.description:
@whattehp406 wrote:

they are all correct in some way

it dous not mater if you use && or dont
its the siplest tojust change the 1 or 2 or 3 of the playerrights to 0

this is my pickup command for my 317

    if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights > 2) {
	        String[] args = command.split(" ");
         if(args.length == 3) {
		int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
		int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
		if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) {
			addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
		} else {
			sM("No such item.");
		}
	} else {
		sM("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100");
	}
    }

just change the 2 to 0 and ur ok

and if you have nothing better to do then flaming people,
then ur… sad

Read full topic

item.title: Does Any1 Know How
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

@kickyamom50. I’ll think you’ll find, you’re an idiot.

My code was correct as it was an example. You’re code is EXACTLY the same just without the AND operator, so what? You’re telling me my code is wrong because it has the AND operator? It also explains what to do with that as I’m not just going to give him the code like you.

Read full topic

item.title: Does Any1 Know How
item.dc:creator: @kickyamom50 kickyamom50
item.description:
@kickyamom50 wrote:

[quote=“Epic Steve, post:6, topic:362157”][quote author=Thetwistedsnake link=topic=458444.msg3354618#msg3354618 date=1285689109]

Why would you like to get it a spawning one?
Btw. To do it do:
Source>Client and do: CTRL+F and type pickup.
Once you get to: if.(commandstartswith(“Pickup”) && playerRights >=2){
Change it to:
if.(commandstartswith(“Pickup”) && playerRights >=0){

wrong
search pickup till u see soemthing like this…
if.(commandstartswith(“Pickup”) && playerRights >=1){
change it to
if.(commandstartswith(“Pickup”)){
stijin12 your error was…
if.(commandstartswith(“Pickup”) && playerRights >=0){
means higher than 0/player so anyone higher than zero/player…
mine means anyone:)
[/quote][quote author=Stijn12 link=topic=458444.msg3354611#msg3354611 date=1285688456]
Why would you like to get it a spawning one?
Btw. To do it do:
Source>Client and do: CTRL+F and type pickup.
Once you get to: if.(commandstartswith(“Pickup”) && playerRights >=2){
Change it to:
if.(commandstartswith(“Pickup”) && playerRights >=0){

[/quote]

You’re both wrong.

It’s actually, if(command.startsWith(“pickup”)

An example of this command would be.

if(command.startsWith(“pickup”) && playerRights > 1) {
…
}

Don’t just copy this code. It will not work.

Also, if you look at the code you’ll see this sign, && - This is the boolean operator AND.

What ever follows this MUST be true therefore if the && is followed by playerRights > 1 what the command is saying in English is; If the command starts with pickup AND playerRights are HIGHER than 1. (2, 3, 4 and so on…)

(Read more about the operators at the bottom of this post, link 1)

You must know what playerRights are; If you don’t just ask.
With this information you should be able to change this command to your liking.

References;
[1] - http://download.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/nutsandbolts/operators.html[/quote]

You are also wrong, it’s actually this for the first line.

if(command.startsWith("pickup")) {

Read full topic

item.description:
@Christiaan wrote:

[quote=“Thetwistedsnake, post:3, topic:362157”][quote author=Stijn12 link=topic=458444.msg3354611#msg3354611 date=1285688456]
Why would you like to get it a spawning one?
Btw. To do it do:
Source>Client and do: CTRL+F and type pickup.
Once you get to: if.(commandstartswith(“Pickup”) && playerRights >=2){
Change it to:
if.(commandstartswith(“Pickup”) && playerRights >=0){
[/quote]
wrong
search pickup till u see soemthing like this…
if.(commandstartswith(“Pickup”) && playerRights >=1){
change it to
if.(commandstartswith(“Pickup”)){
stijin12 your error was…
if.(commandstartswith(“Pickup”) && playerRights >=0){
means higher than 0/player so anyone higher than zero/player…
mine means anyone:)[/quote]

That post was wrong, >= means higher than or same as.

means higher than.

Read full topic

item.title: Does Any1 Know How
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“Thetwistedsnake, post:3, topic:362157”][quote author=Stijn12 link=topic=458444.msg3354611#msg3354611 date=1285688456]
Why would you like to get it a spawning one?
Btw. To do it do:
Source>Client and do: CTRL+F and type pickup.
Once you get to: if.(commandstartswith(“Pickup”) && playerRights >=2){
Change it to:
if.(commandstartswith(“Pickup”) && playerRights >=0){
[/quote]
wrong
search pickup till u see soemthing like this…
if.(commandstartswith(“Pickup”) && playerRights >=1){
change it to
if.(commandstartswith(“Pickup”)){
stijin12 your error was…
if.(commandstartswith(“Pickup”) && playerRights >=0){
means higher than 0/player so anyone higher than zero/player…
mine means anyone:)[/quote][quote=“Stijn12, post:2, topic:362157”]Why would you like to get it a spawning one?
Btw. To do it do:
Source>Client and do: CTRL+F and type pickup.
Once you get to: if.(commandstartswith(“Pickup”) && playerRights >=2){
Change it to:
if.(commandstartswith(“Pickup”) && playerRights >=0){[/quote]

You’re both wrong.

It’s actually, if(command.startsWith(“pickup”)

An example of this command would be.

if(command.startsWith("pickup") [b]&&[/b] playerRights > 1) { ... }
Don't just copy this code. It will not work.

Also, if you look at the code you’ll see this sign, && - This is the boolean operator AND.

What ever follows this MUST be true therefore if the && is followed by playerRights > 1 what the command is saying in English is; If the command starts with pickup AND playerRights are HIGHER than 1. (2, 3, 4 and so on…)

(Read more about the operators at the bottom of this post, link 1)

You must know what playerRights are; If you don’t just ask.
With this information you should be able to change this command to your liking.

References;
[1] - http://download.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/nutsandbolts/operators.html

Read full topic
